alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 3:08PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clarendon and east central Orangeburg Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 308 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Holly Hill, or 20 miles south of Manning, moving north at 10 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summerton, Santee Cooper Regional Airport, Santee, Eutawville, Vance, Eautaw Springs, Indian Bluff Recreation Park, St. Paul, Davis Station, Rocks Pond Campground and Marina, Blounts Landing and Mill Creek Marina and Campground. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 93 and 96, and between mile markers 100 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
